snippet: Copycat lawsuits are expected in other states after a judge’s landmark finding on Tuesday that California’s teacher tenure laws are unconstitutional.
abstract: Landmark court decision finding California's teacher tenure laws are unconstitutional will likely lead to flood of copycat lawsuits in other states, shifting battleground on issue from legislatures to the courts; debate has persisted for years, with teachers unions arguing that laws represent important job security and detractors arguing that they make it impossible to fire bad teachers.
lead_paragraph: Copycat lawsuits are expected in other states after a judge’s landmark finding on Tuesday that California’s teacher tenure laws are unconstitutional.

headline.main: Teacher Tenure Ruling in California Is Expected to Intensify Debate
headline.print_headline: Teacher Tenure Ruling Is Expected to Move Debate From Legislatures to the Courts
